long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
YouTube Video Timestamp Repeater

Description:
YouTube Video Repeater is a handy Chrome extension that allows you to seamlessly loop a specific segment of any YouTube video. Whether you're learning a dance routine, studying a tutorial, or simply enjoying your favorite music, this extension lets you focus on the content that matters most.

Features:
- Set Start and End Times: Easily define the start and end times of the segment you want to repeat using intuitive input fields.
- Customizable Loop Count: Specify how many times you want the segment to repeat, ensuring you get the perfect practice or enjoyment.
- Easy Controls: Use keyboard shortcuts ('F' to set start time, 'E' to set end time, 'Q' to quit loop) for quick and efficient operation.
- Floating UI: Access settings and controls conveniently with a floating button that stays visible on the right edge of your screen.
- Quick Setup: Simply install the extension, navigate to any YouTube video, and start looping your desired segment with just a few clicks.

Instructions:
1. Installation:
   - Install the YouTube Video Repeater extension from the Chrome Web Store.

2. Setting Up Loop:
   - Open any YouTube video.
   - Use the floating button on the right side of the screen to access the settings panel.
   - Input the start and end times of the segment you want to repeat in minutes and seconds.
   - Specify how many times you want the segment to repeat.
   - Click 'Set Loop' to start the loop based on your settings.

3. Controlling the Loop:
   - Press 'F' while watching the video to set the current playback time as the start time.
   - Press 'E' to set the current playback time as the end time of the loop segment.
   - Press 'Q' to quit the loop at any time.

4. Managing Settings:
   - Use the floating button to toggle visibility of the settings panel.
   - Adjust start time, end time, and loop count as needed while watching the video.

Enjoy uninterrupted learning, practicing, and entertainment with YouTube Video Repeater!
